name: Fresh Herb Dinner Rolls
author: Stephen Carroll
summary: Soft and tender dinner rolls with the wonderful smell of fresh herbs.
ingredients: 1 cup warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)
directions: In a small mixing bowl, dissolve yeast and sugar in 1 cup warm water
Let stand until creamy; about 10 minutes
In a large bowl, stir together the yeast mixture with milk, eggs, salt, butter, parsley, chives, and 4 cups flour
Add the remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time, until dough has pulled together
Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface, and knead until smooth and elastic, about 8 minutes
Lightly oil a large bowl, place the dough in the bowl, and turn to coat with oil
Cover with a damp cloth and put in a warm place to rise until doubled in volume, about 1 hour
Deflate the dough, and turn it out onto a lightly floured surface
Shape each piece into a round ball, and place into the prepared pans
Cover the rolls with a warm, damp cloth, and let rise until doubled in volume, about 40 minutes
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
In a small bowl, lightly beat the egg white with 2 tablespoons of water; brush egg wash over tops of rolls
Bake in preheated oven for about 30 minutes, or until golden brown
